n"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"name":"_miningAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"validatorCounter","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"getValidators","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"address[]"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"validatorSetApplyBlock","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"name":"_maliciousMiningAddress","type":"address"},{"name":"_blockNumber","type":"uint256"},{"name":"","type":"bytes"}],"name":"reportMalicious","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"name":"_miningAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"banReason","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"bytes32"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"name":"_reportingMiningAddress","type":"address"},{"name":"_maliciousMiningAddress","type":"address"},{"name":"_blockNumber","type":"uint256"}],"name":"shouldValidatorReport","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"name":"","type":"uint256"}],"name":"poolName","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"string"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"randomContract","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"address"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"changeRequestCount","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"name":"","type":"uint256"}],"name":"miningAddressById","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"address"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"stakingContract","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"address"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"getPendingValidators","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"address[]"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[{"name":"_miningAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"isValidator","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"getValidatorsIds","outputs":[{"name":"","type":"uint256[]"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"poolId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":true,"name":"oldMiningAddress","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"name":"newMiningAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"ChangedMiningAddress","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"poolId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":true,"name":"oldStakingAddress","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"name":"newStakingAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"ChangedStakingAddress","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"parentHash","type":"bytes32"},{"indexed":false,"name":"newSet","type":"address[]"}],"name":"InitiateChange","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"name":"reportingValidator","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"maliciousValidator","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"blockNumber","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"reportingPoolId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"maliciousPoolId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"ReportedMalicious","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"poolId","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"name":"name","type":"string"},{"indexed":false,"name":"description","type":"string"}],"name":"SetPoolMetadata","type":"event"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.","methods":{"addPool(address,address,string,string)":{"details":"Binds a mining address to the specified staking address and vice versa, generates a unique ID for the newly created pool, binds it to the mining/staking addresses, and returns it as a result. Called by the `StakingAuRa.addPool` function when a user wants to become a candidate and creates a pool. See also the `miningByStakingAddress`, `stakingByMiningAddress`, `idByMiningAddress`, `idByStakingAddress`, `miningAddressById`, `stakingAddressById` public mappings.","params":{"_description":"A short description of the pool as UTF-8 string (max length is 1024 bytes).","_miningAddress":"The mining address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_stakingAddress` and should never be used as a pool or delegator before.","_name":"A name of the pool as UTF-8 string (max length is 256 bytes).","_stakingAddress":"The staking address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_miningAddress` and should never be used as a pool or delegator before."}},"areDelegatorsBanned(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether delegators of the specified pool are currently banned. A validator pool can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` function).","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the pool."}},"areIdDelegatorsBanned(uint256)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether delegators of the specified pool are currently banned. A validator pool can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` function).","params":{"_poolId":"An id of the pool."}},"banCounter(address)":{"details":"Returns how many times a given validator was banned.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the validator."}},"banReason(address)":{"details":"Returns the reason for the latest ban of the specified mining address. See the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function description for the list of possible reasons.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the pool."}},"bannedDelegatorsUntil(address)":{"details":"Returns the block number when the ban will be lifted for delegators of the specified pool (mining address).","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the pool."}},"bannedUntil(address)":{"details":"Returns the block number when the ban will be lifted for the specified mining address.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address of the pool."}},"changeMetadata(string,string)":{"details":"Changes pool's metadata (such as name and short description). Can only be called by a pool owner (staking address).","params":{"_description":"A new short description of the pool as UTF-8 string.","_name":"A new name of the pool as UTF-8 string."}},"changeMiningAddress(address)":{"details":"Makes a request to change validator's mining address or changes the mining address of a candidate pool immediately. Will fail if there is already another request. Can be called by pool's staking address. If this is called by a validator pool, the function emits `InitiateChange` event, so the mining address change is actually applied once the `finalizeChange` function is invoked. A validator cannot call this function at the end of a staking epoch during the last two randomness collection rounds (see the `RandomAuRa` contract). A candidate can call this function at any time.","params":{"_newMiningAddress":"The new mining address to set for the pool whose staking address called this function. The new mining address shouldn't be a former delegator or a pool (staking address or mining address)."}},"changeStakingAddress(address)":{"details":"Changes the staking address of a pool. Will fail if there is already another request to change mining address (see `changeMiningAddress` code). Can be called by pool's staking address. Can be called at any time during a staking epoch.","params":{"_newStakingAddress":"The new staking address to set for the pool whose old staking address called this function. The new staking address shouldn't be a former delegator or a pool (staking address or mining address)."}},"clearUnremovableValidator()":{"details":"Makes the non-removable validator removable. Can only be called by the staking address of the non-removable validator or by the `owner`."},"emitInitiateChange()":{"details":"Emits the `InitiateChange` event to pass a new validator set to the validator nodes. Called automatically by one of the current validator's nodes when the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter returns `true` (when some validator needs to be removed as malicious or the validator set needs to be updated at the beginning of a new staking epoch). The new validator set is passed to the validator nodes through the `InitiateChange` event and saved for later use by the `finalizeChange` function. See https://openethereum.github.io/Validator-Set.html for more info about the `InitiateChange` event."},"emitInitiateChangeCallable()":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` function can be called at the moment. Used by a validator's node and `TxPermission` contract (to deny dummy calling)."},"finalizeChange()":{"details":"Called by the system when an initiated validator set change reaches finality and is activated. This function is called at the beginning of a block (before all the block transactions). Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2). Stores a new validator set saved before by the `emitInitiateChange` function and passed through the `InitiateChange` event. After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set. If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function, an old validator set is also stored into the `_previousValidators` array. The `finalizeChange` is only called once for each `InitiateChange` event emitted. The next `InitiateChange` event is not emitted until the previous one is not yet finalized by the `finalizeChange` (see the code of `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter). The function has unlimited gas (according to OpenEthereum and/or Nethermind client code)."},"getPendingValidators()":{"details":"Returns the current array of validators which should be passed to the `InitiateChange` event. The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function. Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all validator nodes."},"getPendingValidatorsIds()":{"details":"Returns the current array of validators (their pool ids). The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function. Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all validator nodes."},"getValidators()":{"details":"Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses) which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node."},"getValidatorsIds()":{"details":"Returns the current validator set (an array of pool ids)."},"initialize(address,address,address,address[],address[],bool)":{"details":"Initializes the network parameters. Used by the constructor of the `InitializerAuRa` contract.","params":{"_blockRewardContract":"The address of the `BlockRewardAuRa` contract.","_firstValidatorIsUnremovable":"The boolean flag defining whether the first validator in the `_initialMiningAddresses/_initialStakingAddresses` array is non-removable. Should be `false` for a production network.","_initialMiningAddresses":"The array of initial validators' mining addresses.","_initialStakingAddresses":"The array of initial validators' staking addresses.","_randomContract":"The address of the `RandomAuRa` contract.","_stakingContract":"The address of the `StakingAuRa` contract."}},"initiateChangeAllowed()":{"details":"A boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` can be called at the moment. Used by the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter. This flag is set to `false` by the `emitInitiateChange` and set to `true` by the `finalizeChange` function. When the `InitiateChange` event is emitted by `emitInitiateChange`, the next `emitInitiateChange` call is not possible until the validator set from the previous call is finalized by the `finalizeChange` function."},"isInitialized()":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called."},"isReportValidatorValid(address,bool)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address) is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address) can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious` function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.","params":{"_miningAddress":"The validator's mining address.","_reportingValidator":"Set to true if _miningAddress belongs to reporting validator. Set to false, if _miningAddress belongs to malicious validator."}},"isValidator(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is in the current validator set. See also the `getValidators` getter."},"isValidatorBanned(address)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is currently banned. A validator can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function).","params":{"_miningAddress":"The mining address."}},"isValidatorIdBanned(uint256)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified pool id is currently banned. A validator can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function).","params":{"_poolId":"The pool id."}},"isValidatorOrPending(uint256)":{"details":"Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified pool id is a validator or is in the `_pendingValidators` or `_finalizeValidators` array. Used by the `StakingAuRa.maxWithdrawAllowed` and `StakingAuRa.maxWithdrawOrderAllowed` getters.","params":{"_poolId":"The pool id."}},"newValidatorSet()":{"details":"Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract. Automatically called by the `BlockRewardAuRa.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch."},"removeMaliciousValidators(address[])":{"details":"Removes malicious validators. Called by the `RandomAuRa.onFinishCollectRound` function.","params":{"_miningAddresses":"The mining addresses of the malicious validators."}},"reportMalicious(address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Reports that the malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block. Called by the node of each honest validator after the specified validator misbehaved. See https://openethereum.github.io/Validator-Set.html#reporting-contract Can only be called when the `reportMaliciousCallable` getter returns `true`.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number where the misbehavior was observed.","_maliciousMiningAddress":"The mining address of the malicious validator."}},"reportMaliciousCallable(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called by the specified validator with the given parameters. Used by the `reportMalicious` function and `TxPermission` contract. Also, returns a boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting during the current staking epoch.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.","_maliciousMiningAddress":"The mining address of the malicious validator which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.","_reportingMiningAddress":"The mining address of the reporting validator which is calling the `reportMalicious` function."},"return":"`bool callable` - The boolean flag indicating whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called at the moment. `bool removeReportingValidator` - The boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting. This flag is only used by the `reportMalicious` function."},"shouldValidatorReport(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Only used by Ethereum client (see https://github.com/openethereum/parity-ethereum/pull/11245). Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator should report about some validator's misbehaviour at the specified block.","params":{"_blockNumber":"The block number at which the validator misbehaved.","_maliciousMiningAddress":"The mining address of malicious validator.","_reportingMiningAddress":"The mining address of validator who reports."}},"validatorCounter(address)":{"details":"Returns how many times the given mining address has become a validator."},"validatorsToBeFinalized()":{"details":"Returns a validator set about to be finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.","params":{"forNewEpoch":"A boolean flag indicating whether the `miningAddresses` array was formed by the `newValidatorSet` function. The `finalizeChange` function logic depends on this flag.","miningAddresses":"An array set by the `emitInitiateChange` function."}},"validatorsToBeFinalizedIds()":{"details":"Returns a validator set about to be finalized by the `finalizeChange` function."}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/ValidatorSetAuRa.sol":"ValidatorSetAuRa"},"evmVersion":"petersburg","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/ValidatorSetAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc817a9f7f87442553aceff9b399a016a80d9dea9565a9bd877aa7ef10f72e15b","urls":["bzzr://c5ed5828e28a6406e7814400d9a3c29fa514cd402bea29d519a32ce0326cac45","dweb:/ipfs/QmS47zg6AU2Xbz2rRYoNjBoiP7jxo7jCdGkLdVFydhvwMM"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/interfaces/IBlockRewardAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd8d0b6febd2efc045445b7a48d5397c31a087ea1129e21bd3dc7e44e9bc89515","urls":["bzzr://8f58cbe338da045bca94c5582267f64ec973a879523c2505929e36b3291b3022","dweb:/ipfs/QmSjFBkLjKoe9JSY8Qe9jWzZBfemyzjym66D32JdTtTWoM"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/interfaces/IRandomAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0x66b431bcbdd999c013b0223ca0c8feb88674d90ecf68a1ccc59419c033c0c21b","urls":["bzzr://36604bbf54eb2220468856bb229b06caca862d6e9b69bbaf8733f53ec2ab4dd1","dweb:/ipfs/QmVd3RFu4nr482o1UVGPdRXRzippd5iWyif7MPUw4hiEiP"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/interfaces/IStakingAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa36b58120690351c3172ae2f9c07fa249df40461e59025a5a2c152e22235d502","urls":["bzzr://6096df19862e816f1f3e2717d5bc0a7a827f74df6a36c6505875f5ae08306a4f","dweb:/ipfs/QmavHRDv8H4t1S2vhh9aBic5U7fpSssMqS61mg8VpTJdtu"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/interfaces/IValidatorSetAuRa.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1fe05324cb277b4163cad2ce957c20806544a550832161676c067ef21b8075ac","urls":["bzzr://831ff6e500e6d4e164d066b4e1d4d3946e1ee9b1980125835e8b4f952d811faf","dweb:/ipfs/Qmf5nFvaBT1baMMykiNFkQ15xqg1PQzkWj9g1bThuja9yS"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/libs/SafeMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0xb480033e8328684139cda6d81df5177232365ea84d7eefe4f7a893db1621b694","urls":["bzzr://7ee15bb54eb1b521fce8721514ad86f3081ee63dd126c68ccaaf40ba887df0a1","dweb:/ipfs/QmZkvLwQQmc3vmX7hhN4ru6BSxCw8Eghg7yDSKPrqZswVw"]},"/Users/akshaypatil/Documents/etherlite/pos-contracts/posdao-etherlite/contracts/upgradeability/UpgradeabilityAdmin.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9addb17fda1bc4c4f8ba64e929be2acdb29472f9d3cfe18491852c0617d20169","urls":["bzzr://c0af15280f0b0edeedb355bea94acfaa3142e361b61f8356937ca1b039f131dd","dweb:/ipfs/QmRmtnWMBvXYFBNppWcEdVTakMwPgqB4JhnXgMuT48yEou"]}},"version":1}

nodes.documentation:
@dev Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators
 before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.
nodes.name: ValidatorSetAuRa
ChangedMiningAddress
ChangedStakingAddress
InitiateChange
ReportedMalicious
SetPoolMetadata

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the `initialize` function was called before.
nodes.name: onlyInitialized

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the caller is the BlockRewardAuRa contract address.
nodes.name: onlyBlockRewardContract

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the caller is the RandomAuRa contract address.
nodes.name: onlyRandomContract

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the caller is the StakingAuRa contract address.
nodes.name: onlyStakingContract

nodes.documentation: @dev Ensures the caller is the SYSTEM_ADDRESS. See https://openethereum.github.io/Validator-Set.html
nodes.name: onlySystem

nodes.documentation:
@dev Makes the non-removable validator removable. Can only be called by the staking address of the
 non-removable validator or by the `owner`.
nodes.name: clearUnremovableValidator
changeMetadata

nodes.documentation:
@dev Makes a request to change validator's mining address or changes the mining address of a candidate pool
 immediately. Will fail if there is already another request. Can be called by pool's staking address.
 If this is called by a validator pool, the function emits `InitiateChange` event,
 so the mining address change is actually applied once the `finalizeChange` function is invoked.
 A validator cannot call this function at the end of a staking epoch during the last
 two randomness collection rounds (see the `RandomAuRa` contract).
 A candidate can call this function at any time.
 @param _newMiningAddress The new mining address to set for the pool
 whose staking address called this function. The new mining address shouldn't be a former
 delegator or a pool (staking address or mining address).
nodes.name: changeMiningAddress
changeStakingAddress

nodes.documentation:
@dev Emits the `InitiateChange` event to pass a new validator set to the validator nodes.
 Called automatically by one of the current validator's nodes when the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter
 returns `true` (when some validator needs to be removed as malicious or the validator set needs to be
 updated at the beginning of a new staking epoch). The new validator set is passed to the validator nodes
 through the `InitiateChange` event and saved for later use by the `finalizeChange` function.
 See https://openethereum.github.io/Validator-Set.html for more info about the `InitiateChange` event.
nodes.name: emitInitiateChange

nodes.documentation:
@dev Called by the system when an initiated validator set change reaches finality and is activated.
 This function is called at the beginning of a block (before all the block transactions).
 Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2). Stores a new validator set saved
 before by the `emitInitiateChange` function and passed through the `InitiateChange` event.
 After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set.
 If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function,
 an old validator set is also stored into the `_previousValidators` array.
 The `finalizeChange` is only called once for each `InitiateChange` event emitted. The next `InitiateChange`
 event is not emitted until the previous one is not yet finalized by the `finalizeChange`
 (see the code of `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter).
 The function has unlimited gas (according to OpenEthereum and/or Nethermind client code).
nodes.name: finalizeChange
initialize

nodes.documentation:
@dev Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools
 is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and
 stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.
 Automatically called by the `BlockRewardAuRa.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch.
nodes.name: newValidatorSet

nodes.documentation:
@dev Removes malicious validators. Called by the `RandomAuRa.onFinishCollectRound` function.
 @param _miningAddresses The mining addresses of the malicious validators.
nodes.name: removeMaliciousValidators
reportMalicious
addPool
areDelegatorsBanned
areIdDelegatorsBanned

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns how many times a given validator was banned.
 @param _miningAddress The mining address of the validator.
nodes.name: banCounter

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the block number when the ban will be lifted for the specified mining address.
 @param _miningAddress The mining address of the pool.
nodes.name: bannedUntil
bannedDelegatorsUntil
banReason

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` function can be called
 at the moment. Used by a validator's node and `TxPermission` contract (to deny dummy calling).
nodes.name: emitInitiateChangeCallable

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the current array of validators which should be passed to the `InitiateChange` event.
 The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious
 or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function.
 Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then
 used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all
 validator nodes.
nodes.name: getPendingValidators

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the current array of validators (their pool ids).
 The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious
 or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function.
 Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then
 used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all
 validator nodes.
nodes.name: getPendingValidatorsIds

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses)
 which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node.
nodes.name: getValidators

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the current validator set (an array of pool ids).
nodes.name: getValidatorsIds

nodes.documentation:
@dev A boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` can be called at the moment.
 Used by the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter. This flag is set to `false` by the `emitInitiateChange`
 and set to `true` by the `finalizeChange` function. When the `InitiateChange` event is emitted by
 `emitInitiateChange`, the next `emitInitiateChange` call is not possible until the validator set from
 the previous call is finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.
nodes.name: initiateChangeAllowed

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called.
nodes.name: isInitialized

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is in the current validator set.
 See also the `getValidators` getter.
nodes.name: isValidator
isReportValidatorValid
isValidatorBanned
isValidatorIdBanned
isValidatorOrPending
reportMaliciousCallable
shouldValidatorReport

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns how many times the given mining address has become a validator.
nodes.name: validatorCounter
validatorsToBeFinalized

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns a validator set about to be finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.
nodes.name: validatorsToBeFinalizedIds

nodes.documentation:
@dev Called by `finalizeChange` function to apply mining address change
 requested by a validator through `changeMiningAddress` function.
nodes.name: _applyMiningAddressChangeRequest
_changeMiningAddress
_clearReportingCounter
_finalizeNewValidators
_setPendingValidatorsChanged

@dev Marks the pending validator set as unchanged before passing it to the `InitiateChange` event
 (and then to the `finalizeChange` function). Called by the `emitInitiateChange` function.
nodes.name: _unsetPendingValidatorsChanged
_setPoolMetadata
_incrementReportingCounter
_removeMaliciousValidator

nodes.name: _savePreviousValidators
_setPendingValidators
_addPool

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the future block number until which a validator is banned.
 Used by the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function.
nodes.name: _banUntil

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns the current block number. Needed mostly for unit tests.
nodes.name: _getCurrentBlockNumber
_getRandomIndex

nodes.documentation:
@dev Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators
 before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.
nodes.name: ValidatorSetAuRa
ChangedMiningAddress
ChangedStakingAddress

devdoc.details: Stores the current validator set and contains the logic for choosing new validators before each staking epoch. The logic uses a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract.

addPool(address,address,string,string).details: Binds a mining address to the specified staking address and vice versa, generates a unique ID for the newly created pool, binds it to the mining/staking addresses, and returns it as a result. Called by the `StakingAuRa.addPool` function when a user wants to become a candidate and creates a pool. See also the `miningByStakingAddress`, `stakingByMiningAddress`, `idByMiningAddress`, `idByStakingAddress`, `miningAddressById`, `stakingAddressById` public mappings.

params._description: A short description of the pool as UTF-8 string (max length is 1024 bytes).
params._miningAddress: The mining address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_stakingAddress` and should never be used as a pool or delegator before.
params._name: A name of the pool as UTF-8 string (max length is 256 bytes).
params._stakingAddress: The staking address of the newly created pool. Cannot be equal to the `_miningAddress` and should never be used as a pool or delegator before.

areDelegatorsBanned(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether delegators of the specified pool are currently banned. A validator pool can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` function).

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the pool.

areIdDelegatorsBanned(uint256).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether delegators of the specified pool are currently banned. A validator pool can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` function).

banCounter(address).details: Returns how many times a given validator was banned.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the validator.

banReason(address).details: Returns the reason for the latest ban of the specified mining address. See the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function description for the list of possible reasons.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the pool.

bannedDelegatorsUntil(address).details: Returns the block number when the ban will be lifted for delegators of the specified pool (mining address).

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the pool.

bannedUntil(address).details: Returns the block number when the ban will be lifted for the specified mining address.

params._miningAddress: The mining address of the pool.

changeMetadata(string,string).details: Changes pool's metadata (such as name and short description). Can only be called by a pool owner (staking address).

params._description: A new short description of the pool as UTF-8 string.
params._name: A new name of the pool as UTF-8 string.

changeMiningAddress(address).details: Makes a request to change validator's mining address or changes the mining address of a candidate pool immediately. Will fail if there is already another request. Can be called by pool's staking address. If this is called by a validator pool, the function emits `InitiateChange` event, so the mining address change is actually applied once the `finalizeChange` function is invoked. A validator cannot call this function at the end of a staking epoch during the last two randomness collection rounds (see the `RandomAuRa` contract). A candidate can call this function at any time.

params._newMiningAddress: The new mining address to set for the pool whose staking address called this function. The new mining address shouldn't be a former delegator or a pool (staking address or mining address).

changeStakingAddress(address).details: Changes the staking address of a pool. Will fail if there is already another request to change mining address (see `changeMiningAddress` code). Can be called by pool's staking address. Can be called at any time during a staking epoch.

params._newStakingAddress: The new staking address to set for the pool whose old staking address called this function. The new staking address shouldn't be a former delegator or a pool (staking address or mining address).

clearUnremovableValidator().details: Makes the non-removable validator removable. Can only be called by the staking address of the non-removable validator or by the `owner`.

emitInitiateChange().details: Emits the `InitiateChange` event to pass a new validator set to the validator nodes. Called automatically by one of the current validator's nodes when the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter returns `true` (when some validator needs to be removed as malicious or the validator set needs to be updated at the beginning of a new staking epoch). The new validator set is passed to the validator nodes through the `InitiateChange` event and saved for later use by the `finalizeChange` function. See https://openethereum.github.io/Validator-Set.html for more info about the `InitiateChange` event.

emitInitiateChangeCallable().details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` function can be called at the moment. Used by a validator's node and `TxPermission` contract (to deny dummy calling).

finalizeChange().details: Called by the system when an initiated validator set change reaches finality and is activated. This function is called at the beginning of a block (before all the block transactions). Only valid when msg.sender == SUPER_USER (EIP96, 2**160 - 2). Stores a new validator set saved before by the `emitInitiateChange` function and passed through the `InitiateChange` event. After this function is called, the `getValidators` getter returns the new validator set. If this function finalizes a new validator set formed by the `newValidatorSet` function, an old validator set is also stored into the `_previousValidators` array. The `finalizeChange` is only called once for each `InitiateChange` event emitted. The next `InitiateChange` event is not emitted until the previous one is not yet finalized by the `finalizeChange` (see the code of `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter). The function has unlimited gas (according to OpenEthereum and/or Nethermind client code).

getPendingValidators().details: Returns the current array of validators which should be passed to the `InitiateChange` event. The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function. Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all validator nodes.

getPendingValidatorsIds().details: Returns the current array of validators (their pool ids). The pending array is changed when a validator is removed as malicious or the validator set is updated by the `newValidatorSet` function. Every time the pending array is changed, it is marked by the `_setPendingValidatorsChanged` and then used by the `emitInitiateChange` function which emits the `InitiateChange` event to all validator nodes.

getValidators().details: Returns the current validator set (an array of mining addresses) which always matches the validator set kept in validator's node.

getValidatorsIds().details: Returns the current validator set (an array of pool ids).

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: Initializes the network parameters. Used by the constructor of the `InitializerAuRa` contract.

params._firstValidatorIsUnremovable: The boolean flag defining whether the first validator in the `_initialMiningAddresses/_initialStakingAddresses` array is non-removable. Should be `false` for a production network.
params._initialMiningAddresses: The array of initial validators' mining addresses.
params._initialStakingAddresses: The array of initial validators' staking addresses.

initiateChangeAllowed().details: A boolean flag indicating whether the `emitInitiateChange` can be called at the moment. Used by the `emitInitiateChangeCallable` getter. This flag is set to `false` by the `emitInitiateChange` and set to `true` by the `finalizeChange` function. When the `InitiateChange` event is emitted by `emitInitiateChange`, the next `emitInitiateChange` call is not possible until the validator set from the previous call is finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.

isInitialized().details: Returns a boolean flag indicating if the `initialize` function has been called.

isReportValidatorValid(address,bool).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator (mining address) is able to call the `reportMalicious` function or whether the specified validator (mining address) can be reported as malicious. This function also allows a validator to call the `reportMalicious` function several blocks after ceasing to be a validator. This is possible if a validator did not have the opportunity to call the `reportMalicious` function prior to the engine calling the `finalizeChange` function.

params._reportingValidator: Set to true if _miningAddress belongs to reporting validator. Set to false, if _miningAddress belongs to malicious validator.

isValidator(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is in the current validator set. See also the `getValidators` getter.

isValidatorBanned(address).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified mining address is currently banned. A validator can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function).

isValidatorIdBanned(uint256).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified pool id is currently banned. A validator can be banned when they misbehave (see the `_removeMaliciousValidator` internal function).

isValidatorOrPending(uint256).details: Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified pool id is a validator or is in the `_pendingValidators` or `_finalizeValidators` array. Used by the `StakingAuRa.maxWithdrawAllowed` and `StakingAuRa.maxWithdrawOrderAllowed` getters.

newValidatorSet().details: Implements the logic which forms a new validator set. If the number of active pools is greater than MAX_VALIDATORS, the logic chooses the validators randomly using a random seed generated and stored by the `RandomAuRa` contract. Automatically called by the `BlockRewardAuRa.reward` function at the latest block of the staking epoch.

removeMaliciousValidators(address[]).details: Removes malicious validators. Called by the `RandomAuRa.onFinishCollectRound` function.

params._miningAddresses: The mining addresses of the malicious validators.

reportMalicious(address,uint256,bytes).details: Reports that the malicious validator misbehaved at the specified block. Called by the node of each honest validator after the specified validator misbehaved. See https://openethereum.github.io/Validator-Set.html#reporting-contract Can only be called when the `reportMaliciousCallable` getter returns `true`.

params._blockNumber: The block number where the misbehavior was observed.
params._maliciousMiningAddress: The mining address of the malicious validator.

reportMaliciousCallable(address,address,.details: Returns whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called by the specified validator with the given parameters. Used by the `reportMalicious` function and `TxPermission` contract. Also, returns a boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting during the current staking epoch.

params._blockNumber: The block number which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.
params._maliciousMiningAddress: The mining address of the malicious validator which is passed to the `reportMalicious` function.
params._reportingMiningAddress: The mining address of the reporting validator which is calling the `reportMalicious` function.

reportMaliciousCallable(address,address,.return: `bool callable` - The boolean flag indicating whether the `reportMalicious` function can be called at the moment. `bool removeReportingValidator` - The boolean flag indicating whether the reporting validator should be removed as malicious due to excessive reporting. This flag is only used by the `reportMalicious` function.

shouldValidatorReport(address,address,ui.details: Only used by Ethereum client (see https://github.com/openethereum/parity-ethereum/pull/11245). Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the specified validator should report about some validator's misbehaviour at the specified block.

params._blockNumber: The block number at which the validator misbehaved.
params._maliciousMiningAddress: The mining address of malicious validator.
params._reportingMiningAddress: The mining address of validator who reports.

validatorCounter(address).details: Returns how many times the given mining address has become a validator.

validatorsToBeFinalized().details: Returns a validator set about to be finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.

params.forNewEpoch: A boolean flag indicating whether the `miningAddresses` array was formed by the `newValidatorSet` function. The `finalizeChange` function logic depends on this flag.
params.miningAddresses: An array set by the `emitInitiateChange` function.

validatorsToBeFinalizedIds().details: Returns a validator set about to be finalized by the `finalizeChange` function.
